Class CareerCenterStaffRepository

java.lang.Object
database.CareerCenterStaffRepository
All Implemented Interfaces:
CrudRepository<CareerCenterStaff, String>
public class CareerCenterStaffRepository extends Object implements CrudRepository<CareerCenterStaff, String>
In-memory repository for managing CareerCenterStaff entities.

This repository provides CRUD operations for career center staff records and supports CSV-based persistence for application bootstrap and exit persistence routines.

The repository maintains staff records in insertion order for predictable iteration and exports. It implements flexible CSV header parsing to accommodate various column naming conventions.

    • loadFromCsv

      public void loadFromCsv(String path) throws IOException
      Loads staff records from a CSV file with flexible header recognition.

      The CSV file can use respective column headers for each field:

      • User ID: "staffid"
      • Name: "name"
      • Role: "role"
      • Department: "department"
      • Email: "email"
      • Password: "password"

      If the user ID is missing from a row, that row is skipped and an error is logged. Missing optional fields are set to empty strings or default values:

      • Role defaults to "Staff" if not specified
      • Password defaults to "password" if not specified
      Parameters:
      path - the input CSV file path
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading the file
      SecurityException - if file access is denied

    • saveToCsv

      public void saveToCsv(String path) throws IOException
      Saves all staff records to a CSV file with standardized column headers.

      The CSV file is created with the following columns in this exact order:

      1. StaffID
      2. Name
      3. Role
      4. Department
      5. Email
      6. Password

      Parent directories are created automatically if they don't exist. If the file already exists, it will be overwritten.

      Parameters:
      path - the output CSV file path
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while writing the file
      SecurityException - if file access is denied

    • findByDepartment

      public List<CareerCenterStaff> findByDepartment(String department)
      Finds all staff members in a specific department.

      The department comparison is case-insensitive. If the department parameter is null, an empty list is returned.

      Parameters:
      department - the department to search for
      Returns:
      a list of staff members in the specified department, or empty list if none found
